content_parts.content:
Open item tracking improves supplier and customer account management by providing visibility on outstanding payables and receivables.

On the Accounts payable open item and Accounts receivable open item pages, you can view and sort a list of open items with details such as supplier or customer name, due date, amounts, currency, and a link to the original document. You can also export results to an Excel or CSV file.

These pages are only available if you do not integrate with Sage Intacct.

content_parts.content:
You asked. We listened.

When you specify a tax type as purchasing or sales, controls are in place on key business transactions to avoid selecting the incorrect tax type. This includes purchasing and sales orders, receipts, invoices, and memos.

If you integrate with Sage Intacct, you need to resync the tax details to benefit from this new feature.
To ensure accuracy, when you create an exchange rate for a currency, the inverse record with the same rate and date is created.
Streamline workflows with targeted roles for finance. This includes controllers, accounts payable and accounts receivable clerks, and finance managers.

content_parts.content:
You asked. We listened.

Use the Stock transfer order, Stock transfer shipment, and Stock transfer receipt pages to streamline stock transfers between sites sharing the same financial site within a single company.

Efficiently manage the entire transfer process, from creating transfer orders to shipping and receiving goods, while improving traceability and ensuring compliance with financial requirements through accurate stock journal updates and financial postings at each step.

content_parts.content:
You asked. We Listened.

The Stock count and Stock count creation pages were enhanced to be quicker and easier to use:

Stock count creation

  • Filter items by category.
  • Use the In stock only switch to choose whether to include out of stock items in your stock count.

Stock count

  • Scroll document lines indefinitely to explore results without interruption.
  • Validate all zero quantities at once using the Confirm zero quantities bulk action.
  • Delete a line that was added after the stock count started.
  • Create a simple stock count report.
  • Enter a new lot when you add a new line.
  • Navigate to journal entries and monitor the posting status for the associated records on the Posting tab.

When you upload an image, it is automatically resized to improve performance without losing image quality. This includes records like items, customers, BOMs, and so on, that include images.

If you want to store high-res images, you can upload images as attachments that can be up to 100 MB.
